thread.title: Electra prepares for fresh assault from Bramson
thread.title_full: Electra prepares for fresh assault from Bramson

title: Electra prepares for fresh assault from Bramson
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Electra prepares for fresh assault from Bramson Edward Bramson's second stab at Electra is seen as more likely to succeed Not known Katherine Griffiths Published 1 minute ago 
One of the City’s oldest listed private equity funds has launched a fresh campaign to keep a corporate raider off the board, saying his appointment would be “destabilising, divisive and value destructive”. 
Edward Bramson’s second siege of Electra Private Equity is seen as more likely to succeed than his first campaign last year, because he has increased his holding in the group. 
Sherborne, Mr Bramson’s investment vehicle, owns almost 30 per cent of Electra, compared with 20 per cent last year. Sherborne has requisitioned a meeting for November 5 for a fresh vote, at which he must win the backing Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
